dr.evolution.datatype
Class DataType

java.lang.Object
  dr.evolution.datatype.DataType
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AminoAcids, Codons, ContinuousDataType, GeneralDataType, HiddenNucleotides, Microsatellite, MutationDeathType, Nucleotides, P2P, PairedDataType, PositiveDefiniteSubstitutionModel.MyDataType, SimpleCodons, TwoStateCovarion, TwoStates
public abstract class DataType
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Base class for sequence data types.

Version:
$Id: DataType.java,v 1.13 2005/05/24 20:25:56 rambaut Exp $
Author:
Andrew Rambaut, Alexei Drummond

Method Detail

lazyRegisterDataTypes

private static void lazyRegisterDataTypes()
Due to some unpleasant interactions between static initializations in the different classes, I have changed this to a lazy initialization.

dataType -

Returns:

guessDataType

public static DataType guessDataType(java.lang.String sequence)
guess data type suitable for a given sequence

Parameters:
sequence - a string of symbols representing a molecular sequence of unknown data type.
Returns:
suitable DataType object

getValidChars

public abstract char[] getValidChars()
return the set of valid chars if they are defined, if not defined then return null cannot use stateCount and loop, because some data types stateCount is dynamic.

Parameters:

getCode

public java.lang.String getCode(int state)
Get a string code corresponding to a given state. By default this calls getChar but overriding classes may return multicharacter codes.

Parameters:
state - state

return corresponding code

return corresponding triplet string
